title: Oscar maximizes utility with less X, more Y

content.question: Oscar spent his entire income on only two goods: good X and good Y. At his current consumption of the two goods, the marginal utility of X is 8 and the marginal utility of Y is 2. If the price of X is $4.00 and the price of Y is $0.50, then to maximize his total utility, Oscar should have

choices.label: bought more X and more Y
bought more X and less Y
bought less X and more Y
bought less X and less Y

content.answer: bought less X and more Y

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Interpret a specific economic outcome using quantitative data or calculations.
